On 19 June 2010 16:41, Jeff Clune <jclune@...> wrote:
>
> This is great=
. Congrats. Do you have any description and screen shots (or a

n with them) for the Prey Capture experiment? Is this the one from

co-evolution paper? Just curious about that experiment.

Hi Jeff, cheers.

=
The prey capture task is from [Incremental Evolution Of Complex
General Beh=
avior, Faustino Gomez and Risto Miikkulainen (1997)]

  http://nn.cs.utexas=
.edu/downloads/papers/gomez.adaptive-behavior.pdf

It was actually the firs=
t problem domain I coded up way back in 2000
when I was working on a C++ ne=
uroevolution framework. It's one I port
between versions of code to maintai=
n continuity, These days we would
probably design it slightly differently, =
maybe with egocentric
sensors/motors and hyperneat would probably do well a=
t this task also.

I will be making new screenshots soon but for now there =
is a
screenshot of the old prey capture visualization (which is pretty much=

the same) at:

  http://sharpneat.sourceforge.net/screenshots.htm

Colin.
